offer.description:
Are you interested in the world of IT, do you enjoy working with data and exploring them? Do you want to participate in the growth of the company and multiple interesting projects? Are you looking for a job in a friendly environment, with great people and good transport accessibility? Then maybe you are our person!

Letâ€™s find out more!

ğŸ’¡About us:

We are Resistant AI, a start-up established in 2019 by Martin RehÃ¡k and Co-founders. Since we started, we were able to get to the top of Fintech companies within artificial intelligence. We were able to win multiple awards such as "Digital Crime Fighter of the Year'' that we won for the 2nd time in a row, in a Hackathon at ACAMS 21st Annual Conference in Las Vegas, as well as Europas Awards - Hottest AI Startup. We appreciate every award and we hope to continue on this path.

And what do we actually do? We protect the AI and automation systems of modern financial services from manipulation and attack. We do so by forensically analyzing everything from the documents submitted by customers to the ongoing behaviors they exhibit while using the service to uncover and prevent serial fraud, synthetic identities, account takeovers, money laundering and as yet unknown financial threats operating at scale. This is our founding team's second startup, and we closed our series A investment round led by Google Ventures, Index and Credo Ventures. More information about us can easily be found here Resistant AI.

ğŸ”Who are we looking for?

We are currently looking for a new Junior Data Scientist to join our team in Prague (location is mandatory) who will become a valuable part of our company that helps customers all around the world to fight against frauds and money laundering.

â“What youâ€™ll do?

  • Learn about fraud detection on documents and how it is managed by RAI 
  • Analyze customer data and design customized solutions
  • Solve problems and support research team with data-driven answers 
  • Monitor performance of detectors and explore space for improvements
  • Actively cooperate with other teams (mainly with Solution Engineers)

ğŸ’¡It would be great if: 

You know how to work with data and you enjoy it. You are able to think logically about problems, perform good analysis according to assignments and present the final results. It would be great if you are communicative, like to cooperate in a team, meticulous, reliable and can think outside the box. Knowledge of AWS (SQL, Quicksight), is definitely a plus but knowledge of Python is a must. The most important thing for us is your curiosity and willingness to learn new things.

ğŸ«´ And what can we offer you?

  • Working and developing yourself alongside some of the top professionals in the field with more than 17y of experience 
  • A culture that values individual intellect as much as teamwork
  • A rapidly growing company
  • Flexible working hours and home office
  • Modern working environment in the center of Prague
  • 5 weeks of vacation + sick days
  • Team events and sports activities on a regular basis

Got you interested? Send us your CV and let's find out together! We will be happy to chat with you.

Luigiâ€™s Box provides analytics, search, and recommender to more than 2500 eâ€‘shops running on a variety of platforms.

Weâ€™re looking for a colleague who will support our customers and solve their technical problems. You are our person if you are familiar with front-end technology and speak English. CZ or SK language is a must.

  • Familiar with basic FE skills - HTML, CSS and JavaScript - is a must

  • Remote from CZ/SK

  • B2B contract

Tasks and responsibilities

Youâ€™ll be in charge of supporting our customers and solving technical problems. You will be using your frontend programming skills daily.

You will work closely with our product teams who will be at hand for more complex issues.

We expect you to be able to write clear emails, make a phone call with a client, write clear instructions, or record an instructional video.

Weâ€™re not looking for a robot who will go through dozens of emails a day. Weâ€™re looking for a person who will ensure that 10 fewer support tickets come every week. You will join a team of other support colleagues: Zuzana, Zuzana, Suzanna, Samo and Mateusz. You will gather customer feedback and share it with our Development & Sales teams.

Youâ€™re our person if you can look at customersâ€™ problems from a distance, find recurring issues, and write a tutorial or record a video that teaches customers how they can solve their problems themselves.

Requirements

  • You must be familiar with basic frontend technology and know HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

  • 1-2 years of customer support experience, preferably in the SaaS or technical eâ€‘commerce solutions sector

  • Excellent communication, so you help the customer to go through any technical difficulty with an ease

  • Analytical and conceptual thinking â€“ understand the nature of the problem and write a clear procedure to help others solve the problem

  • Love for technical knowledge, ability to understand the technical demands of our customers

  • Patience when handling tough cases

  • Effectively organize and plan activities

Language skills:

  • English - is a must (B2)

  • Slovak or Czech language - is a must

  • Other European language is and advantage

    What's in it for you:

  • Work for a dynamic scale-up in a trending SaaS business with a functional product and paying customers. This gives you the benefit of working for a stable company in the long term.
  • Culture of close collaboration in remote and hybrid environments â€“ frequent online team meetings.
  • 20 or 25 paid days off and 7 sick days as per company policy.
  • Team building activities, internal workshops and off-site activities, events for clients.
  • Flexible working hours, 40 hours a week. You deliver results and are reliable â€“ in return, we respect if you ever need to run errands.
  • We cover 25 â€“ 90 % of the cost of selected language or professional courses.
  • Multisport card (SK, CZ) or equivalent (other countries).
  • Allowance for hardware as per company policy.
  • Occasional small team events in Bratislava, Warsaw, Prague: letâ€™s grab a beer, Christmas dinners, quizzes, sport events (as volleyball, go-karts, laser room) .

offer.position: Internship Opportunity at Trustsoft - Cloud Engineer
offer.description:
Are you a passionate tech student eager to dive into the world of cloud computing, DevOps, and automation? We are offering a unique internship program designed for students focused on IT and computer science to gain hands-on experience in the field of cloud migration and AWS.

What You'll Learn:

As a Trustsoft intern, youâ€™ll have the opportunity to:

  • Learn the ins and outs of migrating from on-premises to AWS: Understand the challenges, solutions, and best practices for cloud migration.
  • Get hands-on with AWS Services: Deep dive into AWS tools, services, and architecture, gaining practical skills that will set you apart.
  • Experience full project lifecycle: Rotate through different teams at Trustsoft, from architecture and DevOps to automation and customer success, giving you a comprehensive understanding of what it takes to make our customers successful.
  • Develop DevOps and automation skills: Work with cutting-edge DevOps practices, including CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure-as-code, and more.

What We Expect:

  • Onsite presence at our offices in Amazon Court, Karlin, Prague: We believe in the value of working closely with our teams and customers to learn effectively.
  • Basic knowledge of Linux: Familiarity with Linux-based systems is required.
  • Experience with at least one programming language: Any scripting or programming language experience (e.g., Python, Java, Bash) will be helpful.
  • Some experience with databases: Whether SQL or NoSQL, any exposure will be an asset.
  • AWS knowledge is a big plus: While not mandatory, any prior experience or understanding of AWS will make your learning curve smoother.

Why Trustsoft?

At Trustsoft, we pride ourselves on creating an environment where innovation and collaboration thrive. This internship offers you the chance to:

  • Be a part of a dynamic and supportive team.
  • Gain real-world experience in cloud migration and AWS architecture.
  • Build a strong foundation in DevOps and automation practices.
  • Get a full 360-degree perspective of our business, from technical solutions to customer satisfaction.

How to Apply:

If youâ€™re excited about cloud technologies and want to be a part of a forward-thinking team, send your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your experience and interest in cloud computing.

Join Trustsoft and take the first step toward becoming a cloud professional!

DODO is unstoppable! ğŸš€ We are a technology and logistics service for e-commerce, retail, restaurants, and fast food, and within a few years, we have become one of the largest last-mile delivery providers in Europe. We currently operate in 6 markets where we partner with the biggest clients to help them deliver their goods to their customers as quickly as possible, so our service must be one step ahead of the rest of the market. We use advanced technology and are developing our own logistics platform, GAIA, which facilitates real-time data collection. This enables us to deliver goods faster, more efficiently, and more sustainably. 

We are looking for a Azure Administrator to join our IT department, responsible for managing the day-to-day operations of Office 365 and Azure services.

What will be your responsibilities?

  • Support our developers with DevOps tasks on our .NET applications - Most of our applications are hosted as PaaS (Azure App Services)
  • Manage hybrid Entra ID / AAD infrastructure with SSO integrations
  • Manage conditional access to Azure resources
  • Troubleshoot, remediate and optimise M365 / Azure
  • Act as a knowledge expert on M365 / Azure, advising on best practice usage and integrations.
  • Design, implement and maintain MDM (Intune) solution and access control policies
  • Manage security operations using Defender
  • Documentation and knowledge sharing
  • Manage other corporate systems including operating system (Windows & Linux) management and patching.
  • Own initiatives and suggestions for new solutions are welcome

Tech Stack

  • Azure DevOps, Jira, Keeper, Microsoft Office 365, Slack, ClickUp, Freshdesk, Salesforce, Microsoft Power Automate, Power BI, Fabric, Microsoft SQL, Cosmos DB, Azure Front Door, InTune, Nagios, Azure VPN, GLPI, FortiGate

What kind of experience should you have?â€¯

  • Strong knowledge of MS Azure and O365 cloud technologies, ideally supported by certifications
  • 3 years' experience in a similar role
  • University or college degree in Information Technology and MS Azure experience an advantage
  • English and Czech - both spoken and written

What DODO has to offer?â€¯

  • Work on a unique logistics data-driven platform in a stable team within one of the TOP3 European last-mile company the opportunity to grow with the DODO
  • Annual bonus scheme and meal allowance
  • Possibility to work from new dog friendly office in Prague â€“ KarlÃ­n (near metro station KÅ™iÅ¾Ã­kova)
  • Flexible working hours, home-office
  • An informal working environment where we feel comfortable, motivated, and supported to be creative and to do our best
  • To be part of the "trendsetter" culture and participate in developing new, unique features and participate in international projects
  • Various company events such as DevCons, inspirational breakfasts, or company-wide teambuilding
  • Opportunities for continuous development - through our internal DODO Academy or various external trainings, conferences, and workshops, ...
  • Possibility to obtain Microsoft and Azure certifications
  • Multisport card at a discounted price
  • 5 weeks of vacation

ğŸ¤ Join us if:

  • You have experience in a similar position and you feel experienced at least mid level
  • You can write simple SQL queries
  • You have logical thinking and a willingness to improve existing technological solutions and processes
  • You are flexible and willing to learn new things
  • Your English and Czech is at a communicative level
  • You can organize your work and prioritize tasks
  • You have a pro-client approach to things
  • You can work independently and as part of a team
  • You want to be part of new projects and actively participate in them

Nice to have:

  • Basic work with Linux servers
  • Basic knowledge of how networks and protocols work
  • Knowledge of the SMS/SMPP protocol
  • Experience with Asterisk server

ğŸ’» Technologies you will work with:

  • SMS/SMPP protocol
  • MySQL
  • Grafana
  • IT networks

offer.position: QA Engineer to Web Product Team
offer.description:
We are Czech product-based company that empowers businesses to leverage their customer acquisition processes. We work with clients from all over Czechia and beyond. 

Over the past 10 years, we have: 

  • Gathered 60+ cool specialists to our team.

  • Launched 10+ external products. 

  • Developed 5+ internal digital products.

  • Brought 1000000+ customers for our clients. 

  • All our achievements have been realized thanks to a purposeful team that focuses on common values.

Weâ€™re looking for a proactive, detail-oriented QA Engineer who will help us boost quality and succeed together.


What we are looking for

  • Minimum of 2 years of experience as a QA Engineer.

  • Knowledge of functional, regression, integration, and performance testing principles.

  • Proven experience with web testing.

  • Ability to verify compliance with UX/UI designs and assess usability.

  • Understanding of data validation processes on both the client and server sides.

  • Basic knowledge of Google Analytics and Meta (Facebook) tracking tools.

  • Tools: Postman, Jira, Confluence.

  • At least Intermediate level of English (B1).

  • Nice to have Russian language skills.

Nice to have

  • Familiarity with performance testing tools (e.g., Lighthouse).

  • Hands-on experience with integration testing.

  • Automation skills: the ability to develop new automation tests in the existing framework and debug existing ones.

What you will do

  • Perform UI/UX, Functional, Integration, Data , Security and other type of testing.

  • Testing APIs, verifying requests, responses, and integrations using Postman.

  • Maintaining detailed bug reports and writing test cases and test plans.

  • Manage incoming bugs from clients and other team members before sending to developers.

  • Investigate tricky bugs.

What we offer

  • Opportunity to build new products from scratch.

  • Trust-based management style and respectful culture.

  • Modern and comfortable office in Pague (KarlÃ­n). 

  • 25 working holiday days + 3 sick days.

The interview process consists of:

  • Intro call with our recruiter.

  • Assessment test.  

  • Interview with the hiring manager.

Join our team!
We look forward to receiving your CV and wish you the best of luck!

  • Lidi. KvalitnÃ­ leadership a pohodovÃ½ kolektiv. KolegovÃ©, kteÅ™Ã­ si umÃ­ pomoci a nikdy nezkazÃ­ Å¾Ã¡dnou legraci.

Who we are looking for:

We are seeking an ambitious and passionate Frontend Developer who thrives in a collaborative environment. You will work closely with a talented team of experienced developers and product managers to write high-quality, maintainable code and contribute to a great user experience on our platform. This role is ideal for individuals who are eager to grow their skills and make a meaningful impact.

What you will be responsible for:

  • Designing architecture, developing, and testing high-quality, scalable frontend features that meet product requirements and deliver value to our customers.
  • Participating in code reviews.
  • Working closely with the product and design team on feature specification and with the tester on QA.
  • Improving the responsive web interface for our users.
  • Developing a user-friendly administration system  for our business partners to easily manage their events and sales.

Tech stack you'll work with:

  • Vue 3 and Vue 2 for building the frontend (Composition API, Options API).
  • Nuxt 3 and Nuxt 2 for server-side rendering.
  • State management libraries (Vuex or Pinia) for managing the application's state.
  • TypeScript for strict typing and robust development.
  • GitLab for version control and CI/CD.
  • HTML5, CSS3, and modern JavaScript (ES6+).
  • Docker and Google Cloud Platform for containerization and scalable cloud infrastructure.
  • Sentry for monitoring and tracking errors to ensure high application stability and performance.

How we imagine you:

  • At least 2 years of experience as a frontend developer, working with JavaScript, Typescript and GitLab (or similar). Familiar with Vue and Nuxt.
  • Overview of current trends in web application development.
  • Able to write clean and maintainable code.
  • You pay attention to details and focus on quality - you test your code before passing it to QA.
  • Basic understanding of backend development.
  • Experience with migrating legacy code is a plus.
  • Forward-thinker, able to come up with innovative solutions to problems.
  • Team player with good communication skills, open to give and receive feedback.
  • Not afraid to ask questions in order to learn, improve and grow.
  • Fluent communication skills in English (B2/C1), Czech is a plus.

Does this sound like your thing? Great! To be considered for the selection process, please send us:

  • your CV or updated LinkedIn profile
  • a few sentences about why you would like to join us at GoOut
  • a few points about a bug you spotted on GoOut and few recommendations on what to improve on GoOut from the FE perspective

What is the process of selecting our new colleague?

  1. Short call with Tereza from HR about your motivation and experience
  2. Call with FE Lead and Product team representative about the details of the role and responsibilities
  3. Trial day in GoOut office with the FE team, and other colleagues from Research and Development dept.
  4. Job offer

Benefits not only for work-life balance ğŸ’™

  • ğŸ’¯ open and transparent communication, strong internal guidelines, no-bullshit attitude
  • ğŸ†“  employment contract or freelancing (terms of other benefits accordingly)
  • ğŸ’»  company MacBook
  • ğŸ  5 weeks of PTO + 5 sick days
  • ğŸ¡  optional home office arrangement
  • ğŸ­  free tickets for some of the events we sell tickets to
  • ğŸ«  an annual birthday voucher, including a one-off voucher on joining the company
  • ğŸ‹  financial contribution to MultiSport card
  • ğŸ¥‚  various team-building activities (including summer bbq, Christmas parties, and more)
  • â˜•  coffee and  24/7 free snacks
  • ğŸŒ³  office located right next to Riegrovy sady (just a few minutes from subway, tram and bus stations - you can also bike to work and take a shower immediately afterwards!)
  • ğŸ¶  dog friendly office

ğŸ‘‹ About us

GoOut.net is a platform that provides event discovery and ticketing services since 2011. We aim to enrich cultural experiences by connecting people with a diverse range of live events, including concerts, theatre performances, art exhibitions, and festivals. You can buy tickets directly via GoOut, save selected events, and even follow your favorite artists and venues. 

As it stands now, GoOut is active in Czechia and Slovakia. In addition to the big cities, we also cover smaller, regional events.

Since 2023 we have been a part of the Piletilevi Group AS, an international ticket sales company that operates in Estonia (Piletilevi), Latvia (Bilesu Serviss), Lithuania (Bilietai.lt) and Romania (Bilete.ro). Every year, the group manages more than 15 million tickets for a variety of events.  

Through shared love for culture and art, as well as digital technologies, we strive to create and maintain a platform that will help everyone find exactly what they need.

Bookbot is a recommerce platform that operates in 4 countries and has already sold over 5 million books. Every day we sell around 15,000 books and receive a little bit more. These are numbers we want to double every year. We are among the 10 of the fastest growing tech startups in the CEE region, we have a number of awards on our shelves and big plans in Germany.

We offer over a million books across different sales channels, and we need each book to be sold at just the right price. The price that works well for us and equally benefits the buyers and sellers who trust us with their books.

We are looking for skilled pricing managers as well as intelligent pricing enthusiasts without previous experience.

What awaits you here

  • Full responsibility for book pricing in Knihobot/Bookbot for CZ/SK/DE/AT and all sales channels.
  • Pricing strategy â€“ create and align pricing principles with company goals.
  • Pricing rules â€“ set and implement basic pricing rules.
  • Pricing development â€“ oversee IT development for pricing functions.
  • Monitor pricing performance.
  • Pricing reporting â€“ create and manage BI reporting for pricing.
  • Ensure the pricing strategy is smoothly applied across all sales channels, maintaining full control of the process.
  • Responsible for key metrics like Average Price of Book Sold across different markets, languages, and channels.
  • Gentle warning: This really isnâ€™t about colourful presentations, pointless meetings, abstract projects or delegating tasks. We need to do the things for real - gloves off, sleeves up, get ready to get the hands real dirty.

What is needed

We are looking both for skilled pricing managers as well as for ambitious graduates without previous pricing experience.

  • You make decisions based on data and logical reasoning. You value logic and hard data over emotions.
  • Persistent in getting things done, even when faced with difficulties.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Proficiency in spreadsheets and data analysis (e.g., Google sheets, Excel)
  • Nice to have is basic programming skills (e.g., SQL, Python, R)
  • Quick to learn and adapt to new challenges.
  • Ability to cut through complexity and simplify problems.
  • Fluent English
  • Previous experience with pricing is a plus.

What we offer

  • An environment where you'll learn a lot, and learn quickly. You'll tackle unique problems, and your work will have a visible impact.
  • Cooperation with your manager TomÃ¡Å¡ and other colleagues like Data Engineer VÃ¡clav, CEO Dominik, CTO David, Data Lead MarkÃ©ta, or with CMO David.
  • Work in a well-established and really fast-growing scale-up that continues to grow for several years in a row. Check out our CEO's post here.
  • 20% discount on books, VIP tariff for the sale of books, parking near the offices in Kolbenova metro station
  • Individual development budget
  • Multisport card
  • Extra annual leave after one and two years of cooperation

Do you want to take responsibility for pricing strategy in a very promising re-commerce scale-up? Send us your CV with a cover letter.

offer.position: Junior Visitor Experience Designer Specialist for dynamic globalğŸŒ startupğŸš€digitizing tour guides
offer.description:
SmartGuide is a digital guide platform that turns every phone into a personal travel guide. 

SmartGuide is a global AI-powered digital travel guide platform based in Prague. We now cover more than 1,300 destinations including official guides for Switzerland Tourism, Gibraltar, Singapore Heritage Board, Prague or Pilsner Urquell Brewery.

Our app works like a guidebook in your pocket, using artificial intelligence to recommend places to visit and routes to take, and telling interesting audio stories about them. It is used by over 1.4 million travelers, mainly from Europe and the US. It works outdoors or indoors, online or offline, by car, bike, or on foot, in 30 languages. 

We offer a self-service content management system, web version, augmented reality experiences, visitor data analytics, and much more.

We are seeking a Visitor Experience Design Specialist to join our team and take over from the person who arranged a deal with a tourist destination or attraction and leads the implementation of the guide, including content and local distribution, to ensure high visitor adoption and great visitor experience See the visitor experience you will implement on Youtube.


Your responsibilities will be:

  • Lead the guide implementation project, ensuring all stages are completed on time, within budget, and in line with client expectations and according to the internal best practice guidelines.
  • Act as the main point of coordination between the sales, content, and marketing teams and the client to ensure seamless delivery and resolve any issues
  • Maintain strong relationships and collaborate closely with clients to understand their needs and advise them on how to optimize the use of our products and services. This will include in-person visits and online consultations.
  • Ensure adherence to best practices and standard procedures during the implementation process, regularly communicating updates and progress to stakeholders.
  • Digitize and optimize guide content provided by clients using SmartGuide Content Management System

You are a great fit if you:

  • Are able to put yourself in visitors' shoes and make sure the guide content and product work well for them
  • Have experience with product testing and/or content creation
  • Are proactive, solutions-oriented, and passionate about client success.
  • Have excellent communication skills and can build strong client relationships.
  • Are able to handle multiple projects with competing deadlines and multiple stakeholders and manage priorities effectively.
  • Have a collaborative mindset and are comfortable working across teams.
  • Are an active driver - you will visit our clients time to time
  • If you can come to our offices in Prague (Opletalova 22) at least once a week.
  • Fluent CZ and EN language is a must

You will get 

  • Visit some of the top tourist attractions for work, incl. a possible use of a company campervan
  • Join a globally recognized company with an innovative product that transforms travel.
  • Work in a dynamic, international environment with a friendly, inspiring team.
  • Startup culture with flexibility and a strong focus on innovation.
  • A high degree of flexibility in working time and location.

If you feel that we will be a good match, download the app and send us your CV.

Join us to create the future of travel!

Position Summary:

At Rossum, we're looking for a tech-savvy problem solver who can provide expert technical support and management for our internal systems as an IT Operations Specialist.

This role is a fantastic opportunity to advance your professional career in one of the most promising startups in Europe. If you are ready to take the next step, thrive in a dynamic, multicultural work environment, and are enthusiastic about supporting our teams with their IT needs, Rossum is the ideal place for you. Join us in ensuring that our IT systems, including Google Workspace, Okta, Slack, and Jira, run seamlessly, and play a key role in our team's success.

The Role

The IT Operations Specialist is responsible for the management and smooth operation of our key IT systems, ensuring that our internal users have a seamless experience. You'll be part of the team responsible for managing and optimizing tools like Google Workspace, Okta, Slack, and Jira, as well as providing technical support to internal users when needed.

This is an on-site role that requires physical presence in the office to address daily support needs and incident management, but working from home is possible at least one day per week. It is well-suited for individuals with prior experience or those eager to deepen their expertise in IT operations and system administration.

Your Mission

As an IT Operations Specialist, you'll play a vital role in maintaining and optimizing our IT systems. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Managing and administering Google Workspace, Okta, Slack, and Jira to ensure smooth operation.

  • Providing technical support and guidance to internal users through email, chat, and in-person support.

  • Diagnosing and troubleshooting a wide range of technical issues related to the managed platforms.

  • Researching and implementing solutions to improve the performance and security of our IT systems.

  • Documenting technical issues and their solutions for future reference.

  • Collaborating closely with the IT team to develop and execute strategies for system optimization and problem resolution.

Requirements:

We're looking for a tech enthusiast with the following qualifications:

  • Excellent communication skills in English and Czech.

  • Strong technical skills with experience in managing Google Workspace, Okta, Slack, and Jira.

  • Knowledge of macOS is required, while familiarity with Windows and Linux operating systems is an advantage.

  • Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.

  • Strong organizational skills and acute attention to detail.

  • Proactive, quick on your feet, and capable of managing multiple tasks.

  • Previous experience in IT operations or a similar role is preferred.

What we offer:

We are building a hyper-growth SaaS startup following the best Silicon Valley practices in Prague.

  • We designed the Employee Stock Option Plan as the fairest in Prague.
  • Enjoyable working environment with a very diverse team (27+ nationalities) in a beautiful office with a 200 m2 terrace and a view of the Prague castle in the heart of Karlin.
  • 5 weeks of vacation, flexible working hours, and home office setup.
  • Tasty snacks & the best coffee and tea in Prague.
  • English and Czech language lessons on all levels.
  • Multisport card to get your workout at any of 2 700 places in Czechia

THE ROLE

Our product development team is looking for a Junior Engineer who brings creative thinking, problem-solving abilities, and a proactive approach to help us build exceptional web and mobile applications for our startup clients.

The product you will be working on is a long-term, hugely successful US-based FinTech product that counts Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, and Bank of America as clients, processing over USD$50 billion in transactions to date. You will be joining a high-performing team consisting of a Tech Lead, Product Manager, Designer and other experienced engineers, working as part of a wider team of ~50 in Prague. You will contribute to both front-end and back-end development, helping our clients' startups achieve their goals.

This role offers a fantastic opportunity to learn new technologies and grow within an innovative environment while delivering impactful solutions. If youâ€™re excited about making a difference in the tech industry, weâ€™d love to hear from you!

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Collaborate with senior developers to design, develop, and maintain web applications
  • Contribute to both front-end (React) and back-end (Node.js) development
  • Implement features based on user stories and technical specifications
  • Participate in code reviews, team meetings, and project planning sessions
  • Actively learn and explore new technologies and frameworks
  • Solve problems analytically and work proactively on challenges

SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS

  • Proficient in English
  • Experience with JavaScript - Knowledge of React for front-end or Node.js for back-end, gained through projects, internships, or academic experience
  • Basic knowledge of TypeScript and CSS
  • Ability to understand and propose solutions for simple algorithmic problems
  • A curious mindset with a strong desire to learn new technologies
  • Analytical and problem-solving skills, able to break down challenges and approach them proactively
  • Desire to work in the office at least 3 days per week

TECH STACK

  • TypeScript
  • Node.js
  • React + Next.js
  • React Native
  • GraphQL, tRPC
  • Material UI
  • Playwright
  • Google Cloud Platform

Note: You donâ€™t need experience with all the above technologies as we are happy to upskill in certain areas. For a detailed overview of the technologies we use, please visit the LINK.

OUR PROJECTS

Weâ€™ve built over 40 successful products. Here are a few from our portfolio:

  • Nasdaq Private Market
  • PlexTrac
  • Vette
  • Plotify

BENEFITS

  • Flexible working hours
  • Hybrid working environment
  • 25 vacation days + 1 birthday day off + 1 additional day for every year working with OAKâ€™S LAB (capped at 30 days)
  • Top-of-the-line MacBook and hardware budget
  • Budget to spend on your growth (books, courses, conferences)
  • Free English lessons
  • Opportunity for a bonus gained from investments in our startup partners
  • Team bonding, happy hours, online games, annual offsite trips
  • Outside of work activity clubs (yoga, traveling, football, tennis, etc.)
  • Snacks and drinks in the office, weekly pizza, monthly breakfast
  • Landmark office right on Old Town Square (dog-friendly)

---

ABOUT US

OAKâ€™S LAB is a technology partner that helps startups, scaleups, and enterprises build software solutions by deploying empowered product teams. Our innovative solutions have created market leaders across multiple sectors.

  • Founded in 2016
  • Built and launched 48 products
  • Combined valuation of our clients is $1.7B

Apify's mission is to make the web more programmable. Why? Because we believe that humans have better things to do than fill information into internet forms, compile Excel sheets of copy-pasted data, or watch thousands of videos to determine whether they include a specific brand logo. Those are jobs for a machine. And just as in the real world we have tools that make our lives easier, we should have tools to make our lives easier on the web.

Web automation can be anything. We robotize unsubscribe flows to save people money and we collect billions of rows of data from all over the world for science, market research, or finding lost children. Fortune 500 companies and small startups alike need this power to make great business decisions.

To support our mission, we're looking for talented and experienced engineers to help us build the next generation of the web, where machines talk to machines and humans do creative work that drives progress. Will you join us ?

Please be aware that we are currently looking only for full-time candidates living in the Czech Republic!

Who are we looking for?

  • You have a good knowledge of JavaScript & TypeScript (Node.js) and Web technologies
  • You are an avid learner and looking to grow your expertise in the web scraping domain and in general
  • You have a problem-solving mindset
  • You're able to write and speak English well
  • You have empathy and patience to understand customers and their needs
  • At minimum 1 year of programming experience (school and self-learning counts)
  • Currently, we are only looking for a full-time commitment
  • You live in the Czech Republic and are able to come to our Prague office at least once a month
  • Even better if you:
    • Have contributed to a non-trivial user-facing product
    • Have experience fine-tuning products for UX/DX
    • Like to write and share experience - tutorials, technical support, tooling, etc.

What you will learn with us?

  • How websites work behind the curtain
  • How to write beautiful code that reads like a novel
  • How to write efficient cloud programs that process hundreds of millions of pages monthly
  • How to contribute to collaborative open and closed source projects and design great APIs that other devs will love to use
  • And potentially, how to build your own team and start your own projects inside the company

Our tech stack:

  • Development: Node.js (with Typescript), Chrome Dev Tools, Crawlee, Apify SDK, Puppeteer, Playwright, JQuery/Cheerio + many other specialized libraries. We also released Python SDK lately and are acquiring expertise in Python scraping tools.
  • Environment: Local IDE for development & testing. Then deploy to the Apify Platform via GitHub for production
  • Tools: GitHub, ZenHub, Notion, GSuite, GitHub Copilot license
  • Process: in-depth onboarding, code reviews, tests, automating whatever we can, using common sense over strict processes

offer.startup: Perfect System s. r. o. (Colosseum Ticket)

offer.description:
At Similarweb, we're revolutionizing the way businesses interact with the digital world by revealing to them everything that happens online. Our cutting-edge platform and unique data empower over 4,300 customers globally, including industry giants like Google, eBay, and Adidas, to make game-changing decisions that drive their digital strategies.

In 2021, we went public on the New York Stock Exchange, and we havenâ€™t stopped growing since!  

We're expanding globally with a new site in Prague and looking for talented people to help build our team. At Similarweb, you'll have the chance to innovate, work with smart colleagues, tackle big challenges, use cutting-edge technologies, and make a real impact on leading companies around the world.

 

Why is this role important at Similarweb?

As an Information Security Analyst, you'll be working closely with our Chief Information Security Officer and playing a key role in our unique security team. ğŸš€  Your work will be crucial in driving essential business needs and security programs, using cutting-edge tech and creative solutions.

You'll also collaborate with various teams across the companyâ€”such as IT, R&D, and other expertsâ€”to ensure that our applications, products, services, and data are monitored and protected with the appropriate security controls. ğŸ”


So, what will you be doing all day?

  • Implement and monitor security procedures, policies, and hardening guidelines.
  • Ensure the systems are patched, updated, and editable according to Similarweb Policy.
  • Implement, configure, and monitor security tools and systems.
  • Automate information security-related infrastructure, endpoints, applications, cloud, and network security systems.
  • Work with technical teams to implement and oversee secure processes, including vulnerability tracking, remediation activities, and secure requirements, to ensure good security practices are being implemented and executed.
  • Handle security tickets as part of security operations on ongoing service and support.
  • Create and maintain security documentation (e.g., technical or procedural requirements).

 

What weâ€™re looking for:

  • At least +3 years of working experience in the information security field or a related discipline 
  • Experience working with security processes, integrations, and solutions such as FW, EDR, SASE, MFA, VPN, DLP, WAF, CDR, logs collectors, etc. -.
  • Knowledge of cloud security best practices (AWS, GCP, Azure) 
  • Knowledge in working with technical teams according to information security frameworks and benchmarks (e.g., OWASP, CSF, CIS, MITRE ATT&CK, etc.)
  • Experience working with security policies and standards such as ISO, SOC 2, etc.
  • Knowledge of programming languages such as - Python, Bash, and PowerShell
  • Knowledge of current network security risks, security trends, and technologies

Itâ€™s a big plus if you have:

  • Hardening endpoints capabilities , such as MacOS, Windows, and virtualization systems

 

Why youâ€™ll love being a Similarwebber:

  • ImpactğŸ˜: Work with the most powerful digital intelligence platform in the world, loved by both customers and employees.
  • InnovationğŸš€: We value open dialogue and empower everyone to bring their ideas forward. You'll have the support and resources to take initiative and drive real change
  • Hybrid Work Model: With our hybrid model, you get the perfect balanceâ€”3 days in our vibrant office and 2 days working from homeğŸ¡.
  • Our Office: Join us in our modern, newly designed office in the vibrant DOCK IN area (Prague 8). It's built to inspire focus and collaboration, stocked with snacks, drinks, fruits, and plenty of space for socializing.
  • Comprehensive Benefits: We offer 5 weeks of vacation, an extra day off during your birthday month, 3 sick days, a multisport card, and plenty more!ğŸ˜
  • State of the art tech stackğŸ‘©ğŸ»â€ğŸ’»: We embrace innovation and use the latest tech, including the powerful MacBook Pro M3!
  • Team events: At Similarweb, we love community! Thatâ€™s why we host team-building events, parties, weekly lunches, and happy hours throughout the year ğŸ‰.
  • Access to Equity programsğŸ’¸: Join in the success of Similarweb by becoming a shareholder!
  • Grow your career any way you choose: Want to become a VP or switch departments? With Career Week, personalized coaching, and our ongoing learning solutions, youâ€™ll find everything you need to grow your career right here!ğŸš€

Adam digitizes the painting industry!

Adam is a rapidly growing Czech startup digitizing the crafts industry. Our goal is to create a Czech unicorn, provide customers with quality craftsmen with just a few clicks, and support local craftsmen in their businesses. And we're on the right track! We've expanded to over 11 countries, received investment from the prestigious domestic fund Presto Ventures and Bolt CEO Markus Villig. This year, one of Europe's most significant edtech venture capital funds, Brighteye Ventures, invested in us. Additionally, Czechcrunch nominated us among the 20 most interesting young or fast-growing companies in their Startup Awards competition this year.

We are looking for an analytical and solution-oriented Junior Project Manager (m/f/d) to join our team.

You'll get the chance to experience what it's like to build an entire market from A to Z - you'll be responsible for marketing, legal and recruitment alongside the day-to-day running of the business. If you aspire to one day run your own business or manage a large department, Adam is the place for you.

We are a small team, led by two founders. Our founders previously built a team of over 100 people at Bolt, one of Europe's largest and fastest growing tech companies. We are more than willing to share our experience with you! In return, we expect an energetic demeanor, hard work and a willingness to continuously learn.

Your work includes:

  • You help to build the team.

  • You support all of Adam's business processes

  • You help us to react quickly to market trends - we need to move with the trends and be able to process an ever-growing number of orders quickly

  • Development and implementation of new expansion strategies within Germany and Austria

  • Communication with customers and partners

  • Continuous improvement of the product according to Adam's value proposition

Who we are looking for:

  • Excellent written and spoken German and English (Full Professional Proficiency). Other languages are an advantage but not a must

  • Excellent communication skills

  • A data-driven analytical mindset

  • A hustler who doesn't stop giving it their all after 20 obstacles a day

  • Degree and no more than 2 years of work experience (relevant experience is a plus but not a must)

Why you'll love it here:

  • You are one of the key people in the most important market in Europe

  • You have the opportunity to build a project that grows by ten percent every month! Including global ambition and the chance to experience how an international start-up works

  • You will work directly with the founders and have weekly meetings for direct exchange

  • You have the opportunity to greatly improve your language skills - your daily work takes place in German and English

  • No corporate dress code, we want to have fun at work and expect the same from you :)

  • You will work with a young, international and super talented team

  • Frequent visits to the headquarters in Prague

  • One week a year with all teams from all countries in Prague: daily activities (volleyball, city rally and much more), daily exchange with all teams and joint strategy development, cozy evenings in bars, restaurants and closing party

  • Attractive remuneration, possibility to earn from â‚¬2300

Here you can see our team on Instagram: @team_of_adam

Have we piqued your interest?

Get in touch now with your resume!

Here you will find articles on how fast Adam is growing and where we are already working:

  1. Businessplus
  2. Forbes

  • Start spoluprÃ¡ce od 1.11.2024.

About Us 

Avvoka is a leading legal technology company specialising in document automation   â€“ we've been used to help build production contracts that licence Game of Thrones, open famous fast-food franchises, and buy and sell billion-dollar companies. Our software platform empowers law firms and in-house legal teams to draft, negotiate, and manage contracts more efficiently. We're a team that is passionate about changing the way the world contracts â€“ we donâ€™t take ourselves too seriously but love to push the technical boundaries and solve hard problems. We value a positive attitude, have a flat and informal structure, and have good senses of humor, making our workplace enjoyable and collaborative. Join us and be part of a team that values innovation, quality, and a positive work environment! 

About You

Youâ€™re a passionate and innovative front-end developer with at least 4 years of experience building web applications. You have a strong foundation in modern HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and youâ€™ve worked with front-end frameworks like Vue.js, and implementing UI across different platforms. You thrive in fast-paced environments where you can dive into solving challenging problems, using your keen eye for detail and troubleshooting skills to deliver polished, responsive, and high-quality code.

Key Responsibiltiies

Front-End Development 

  • Develop and implement Avvokaâ€™s product using a range of technologies, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Vue.js, and Typescript. 
  • Integrate front-end code seamlessly with back-end systems to ensure a cohesive and efficient end-to-end product. 
  • Implement designs, styles, and best practices in accordance with visual mockups, contributing to a user-friendly and visually appealing interface. 

Quality Assurance 

  • Assist in the debugging, fixing, and testing of front-end code to maintain its reliability, performance, and responsiveness across various devices and browsers. 
  • Utilise strong troubleshooting abilities to identify and address issues independently, ensuring a high standard of code quality. 

Learning and Innovation 

  • Stay informed about new front-end frameworks and technologies, actively learning and implementing them to enhance Avvokaâ€™s product. 
  • Contribute to the continuous improvement of the development process by incorporating innovative solutions and best practices. 

Collaboration and User Requirements 

  • Collaborate closely with product managers to gain a deep understanding of user requirements, translating them into practical and efficient front-end solutions. 
  • Be comfortable with ambiguity and independently figure out solutions, showcasing adaptability and a solution-oriented mindset. 

Time Management and Organization 

  • Demonstrate strong time management and organisational skills to efficiently deliver high-quality front-end solutions. 
  • Maintain a detail-oriented approach to contribute to an organised and productive development process.

This outlines your key responsibilities but it is not an exhaustive list. Reasonable changes within the scope of your responsibilities may be required as the job develops.  

Person Specification

The top 5 factors that a successful candidate will have are:

  • A minimum of 4 years Vue.js Experience
  • Experience implementing Vue UI components across applications
  • Responsive web design concepts and implementation 
  • Strong grasp of modern HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and accessibility best practices 
  • Familiarity with Git version control and pull request workflows

offer.position: Technical Support Specialist for B2B with English + ES/PT/IT/FR/DE
offer.description:
Imagine standing at the top of the Empire State Building, taking in the breathtaking view. From the online booking to the seamless entry, every part of your ticketing experience was designed and supported by Ventrata. An industry-leading SaaS platform that helps attractions, tours, and activities to create memorable experiences.

Backed by a passionate team, headquartered in London and with offices in Brno, Lisbon, and remote teams worldwide, weâ€™re expanding rapidly across multiple markets and verticals. Our mission is to help businesses of all sizes scale and grow while preserving their unique identity and spirit.

Be a part of something extraordinary, where your ideas and contributions truly matter. Letâ€™s shape the future of travel together.

The Challenge

We are excited to announce that Ventrata is looking for a B2B Technical Support Specialist to help our clients with their issues. If you love problem-solving and are an excellent communicator, this is the role for you.

Responsibilities and duties

  • Actively improve the customer experience;
  • Work with clients and their employees to identify problems and advise on the solution;
  • Recreate, troubleshoot and independently investigate reported issues;
  • Collaborate with development teams, identify errors and report bugs via internal helpdesk;
  • Master the support channels: Ventrata Chat, Slack and Helpdesk;
  • Help with client onboarding and uploading data to our systems;
  • Supporting internal teams with tasks beyond the job description;

Requirements

  • You are looking for a huge challenge
  • You are interested in technology, you are curious about systems, software and hardware and you are a fast learner
  • You are open-minded person always looking for feedback and ways to improve
  • You take pleasure and pride in your work
  • You do wanna grow with the company
  • You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • B2 English mandatory
  • Analytical mind and problem-solving attitude
  • Ability to effectively describe and document issues
  • Attention to detail
  • Ability to work independently and as a part of a team
  • Spanish/Italian/French/German/Portuguese is a huge plus

Benefits

  • You can work remotely or use our offices in Brno or Lisbon;
  • shifts 9 AM - 5 PM CET,
  • Bonuses for working on national holidays;
  • Paid lunch breaks; paid overtime; performance bonuses;
  • 24 days of paid vacation;
  • Start-up working environment and unique company culture;
  • Team buildings and company remote office. Sounds boring? The whole team met in Spain, Italy, France, Greece and South Africa within the past few years.

Does it sound crazy enough? Send us your CV in English and join us!

About Ventrata

Ventrata is an enterprise ticketing platform designed for high-volume attractions, museums, observatory towers, sightseeing tours, and activity operators. Our all-in-one solution powers online, in-person, and third-party sales, and provides robust functionality for resource management, hardware integrations, and 24/7 live support. 

Leading brands across diverse verticals trust Ventrata's solutions, and our focus on building long-term connections is key to mutual success. Since 2016, we have worked with many City Sightseeing operations and have teamed up with notable companies like Big Bus Tours and Historic Tours of America. Our recent partnerships, including those with English Heritage, Paradoxon, the Empire State Building, Thames Clippers, and many others established over the past two years, show strong potential to evolve into enduring, long-term relationships. These examples represent just a few of our many collaborations driving the innovation behind the 21 million tickets we sold in 2023 â€” a 60% increase from the previous year.

What truly sets us apart is our independence â€” we've been profitable since 2018, with no reliance on venture capital. This financial stability allows us to innovate and grow on our own terms.

We value collaboration and freedom ensuring that every team member has the space to take ownership, be heard, and drive real impact.

offer.position: Onboarding Manager for SaaS startup with the possibility of an employee share and fast growth within the company
offer.description:
Who are we?

At SingleCase.com, we are changing the way law firms  manage their cases and streamlining workflows. We provide innovative software solutions that enable our clients to work more efficiently. To continue to provide excellent service, we are looking for a dynamic and experienced Client Onboarding Manager, to lead our client onboarding team and ensure a seamless experience.

Who are we looking for?

Someone ambitious and hungry for success with excellent organization skill and affinity for technology. The job is hard, the customers are very demanding and in details. The company is growing, is full of great people but has all pros and cons of a growing startup. We love what we are doing, but sometimes it can be messy and chaotic and with unpredictable schedules:-) We need someone who would enjoy this ride.

Job Overview:

As Client Onboarding Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and improving the onboarding process for new clients. You will lead a dedicated team to ensure a smooth transition, identify areas for process improvements and drive innovation throughout the client journey. You will play a key role in ensuring clients feel confident and supported as they integrate our platform into their operations.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Leading and managing the onboarding team to ensure efficient and quality onboarding for all new clients.
  • Oversee the entire onboarding process and ensure all client needs are met and timelines are met.
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams including Sales, Customer Success and Product Development.
  • Identify and implement process improvements to streamline onboarding and improve client experience.
  • Maintain a good understanding of the technical aspects of our product to effectively guide clients.
  • Report regularly on onboarding performance metrics and support continuous improvement efforts.

Requirements:

  • Demonstrable experience in project management and organizational leadership.
  • Experience or strong relationship with technical products or services.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Strong problem solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize effectively.
  • Experience leading a team and working in a client-facing role.
  • Knowledge of software deployment processes is an asset.
